headline: CNN 10
subHeadline: Temporary Truce Deal Between Israel And Hamas; How Black Friday Shopping Has Changed; Story Of A Runway Roomba Vacuum. Aired 4-4:10a ET

utterances.speaker: JENN SULLIVAN, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: In the end discount dash associated with Black Friday appears to be slowing.JEFF GENNETT, CEO OF MACY`S: Clearly the month of November has changed really since the pandemic.

utterances.speaker: SULLIVAN
utterances.sentences: More shoppers are looking to score deals online as many consumers gear up for Cyber Monday.CLAIRE TASSIN, MORNING CONSULT RETAIL & E-COMMERCE ANALYST: A pretty big shift from the Black Fridays. I remember about a decade ago where people would line up early outside the stores now people are shopping in their pajamas.

utterances.speaker: SULLIVAN
utterances.sentences: It`s not just the convenience of shopping from home that has consumers scaling back on in-store shopping. Many retailers rolled outtheir discounts much earlier this year to entice people to spend sooner.

utterances.speaker: HARLEY FINKELSTEI, PRESIDENT OF SHOPIFY
utterances.sentences: It actually started as early as early October and will go right until Christmas time.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: The Black Friday deals have already generated nearly $10 billion in online sales, according to Adobe Analytics. That`s 7.5% more than a yearago. But Black Friday is only the penultimate attempt by retailers to ratchet up their sales. Today, marks the final substantial day of holiday shopping deals Cyber Monday, designed for online shoppers. Did you know that Cyber Monday is expected to generate a record $12 billion in sales, according to Adobe Analytics. Adobe says smartwatches, TVs, toys, and gaming products were the best-selling categories this year. They also saw a notable increase in shoppers who went for buy now, pay later options, 47% more Americans use this flexible payment method compared to last year. And while that may mean that they may end up paying a bit more because of interest, that works better for some. Now, pop quiz, hot shot. Ten-second trivia. What is the oldest operating ballpark in Major League Baseball? Wrigley Field, Fenway Park, Dodger Stadium, or Yankee Stadium? Opening in 1912 Fenway Park with its iconic left field wall opened two years before Wrigley. Although baseball season might be over in the U.S., one of the sport`s most iconic venues is still active in an unexpected way. As we celebrate our shared home, this call to Earth Day, CNN went to the city of Boston to take a look at an urban farm unlike any other, sitting above the front offices of the Boston Red Sox. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Hours before the gates open on a Red Sox game day in late August at Fenway Park in Boston, a different team is hard at work.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS GRALLERT, PRESIDENT, GREEN CITY GROWERS
utterances.sentences: As these crops continue to come out, we`re plant in fall greens, we`re plant in lettuces.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: This is Fenway Farms, a 5,000 square foot garden area on a section of rooftop at the oldest active Major League Baseball Park in America.

utterances.speaker: GRALLERT
utterances.sentences: You know agriculture happens everywhere we`re just bringing it up off the ground and putting it up on a roof.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Chris Grallert is a farmer and the president of Green City Growers, which operates this farm in some 200 other locations, including at 40Boston Public Schools. But none are as visible and perhaps surprising as Fenway Farms.

utterances.speaker: GRALLERT
utterances.sentences: There`s a desire for people to have more locally grown fresh produce and interact with the people who are growing and distributing thatfresh produce. And I think when you have such high visibility like you do at a garden like this, people start to see that it`s possible and it can really be the seed to start the new revolution towards food system transformation.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: The garden first opened in 2015, recycled milk crates formed the raised planters.

utterances.speaker: GRALLERT
utterances.sentences: These are fingerling type potatoes.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Irrigated by a special system that delivers the precise amount needed to each plant.The produce doesn`t have to travel far, just a short walk to Chef Ron Abel and his team. Operating the restaurants and concessions at Fenway.

utterances.speaker: GRALLERT
utterances.sentences: Produce delivery.

utterances.speaker: RON ABEL, SENIOR EXECUTIVE CHEF, FENWAY PARK
utterances.sentences: How you doing buddy?

utterances.speaker: GRALLERT
utterances.sentences: Good to see you as always.

utterances.speaker: ABEL
utterances.sentences: What do you have?

utterances.speaker: GRALLERT
utterances.sentences: Beautiful onions, right off, look at the size of those.

utterances.speaker: ABEL
utterances.sentences: I have the best chef job in the city. Well, actually, maybe the country where I`ve got a rooftop garden that the food travels 100 feet,gets washed, and gets served to everybody. And then this dish that Sean`s putting together is simple. Potatoes we harvested this morning, we`ve got purple potatoes, we`ve got fingerling potatoes, heirloom carrots of different colors, and he just steamed them lightly, and they get seasoned lightly.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Green City Growers estimates Fenway Farms reduces the need for produce to purchase at the venue by 20%.

utterances.speaker: ABEL
utterances.sentences: Mostly we look at quantities and what we can go through and we also look at perishability. So there are challenges here. We can`t predict whatmother nature is going to give us.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Anything left over, along with what`s harvested from a smaller designated area next to the main farm, is donated to a local food rescueand distribution organization called Lovin` Spoonfuls.

utterances.speaker: GRALLERT
utterances.sentences: We can produce anywhere from four to six thousand pounds of fresh produce a year depending on what we`re growing. And so the range ofvegetables, asparagus, and zucchini.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Making the iconic green of Fenway Park even greener.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Today`s story getting a 10 out of 10, the great escape. Shelley Betz from Georgia and her family were busy decorating their home for Christmasand when it was time to clean up all the mess, their robot vacuum was nowhere to be found until they found video evidence of the mysterious getaway. Here`s Jeanne Moos with more. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: JEANNE MOOS, CNN NATIONAL NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Roomba is supposed to work for you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Alexa, can you tell Roomba to clean under the kitchen table?

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: But who knew a Roomba could turn the tables by disappearing?

utterances.speaker: SHELLEY BETZ, ROOMBA OWNER
utterances.sentences: We could not find him. And we looked under all the furniture.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Unbeknownst the Georgia resident, Shelley Betz, Roomba headed out the front door. They`d left open.

utterances.speaker: BETZ
utterances.sentences: We were doing Christmas decorations in and out, and he escaped.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Two days later, Shelley`s husband found him under a bunch of leaves.(On camera): How far did he actually get?

utterances.speaker: BETZ
utterances.sentences: To be honest, he didn`t get very far.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Maybe 10 yards. It was after they found him that they looked back at their ring camera and witnessed his escape.

utterances.speaker: BETZ
utterances.sentences: We were laughing hysterically.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: So was the internet, the little Roomba that could, now that`s a clean getaway. Clean, but Roomba was a mess. He lost his padding and his brushesthough he still works.

utterances.speaker: BETZ
utterances.sentences: He did his job. You know, he was doing what he`s he was born to do.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: So she saluted the runaway Roomba`s escape by adding the George Michael classic.(MUSIC)

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Without Roomba, the family was left in a vacuum.(END VIDEOTAPE)
